bug.author: packetrat
bug.summary: Error during pip install re: tensorflow on Ubuntu

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.83. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/Ciphey/Ciphey>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Ciphey does not use tensorflow :) Please fill out the full bug template, and make sure you are installing the latest version of Ciphey with Python 3+ :)

After hacking away at this on a docker container for an hour, I found the solution: sudo apt-get install python3.8 # The minimum required by ciphey is 3.7, but why stop there? python3.8 -m pip install -U ciphey # Or ciphey==5.2.0 if that doesn't work Please reopen if this doesn't work for you!
